DOC.brief_summary: The study aims to prove differences or equalities in outcome for patients operated with or without a peristomal mesh in the sublay position when establishing a permanent colostomy.
DOC.brief_title: Peristomal Mesh for Prophylaxis of Parastomal Hernia
DOC.detailed_description: Patients are randomized to 2 groups equal in number: a group with mesh implantation and a control group without mesh implantation. Primary endpoint is Parastomal hernia. Secondary endpoints are operating time, infection, obstruction, stenosis, retraction, fistulae, skin related problems and reoperations. Endpoints are correlated to body mass index, previous hernia, age, concurrent illness and cause for colostomy. Patients are followed 4 years after operation with clinical examination
DOC.criteria: Condition with indication for establishing a permanent endcolostomy. Age under 18 ASA score above 3
